snippet: The sale ends a long relationship that had run into trouble over disagreements on policies ranging from top management to the handling of Repsol’s investments in Argentina.
abstract: Mexico's national oil company Pemex announces it will sell 7.86 percent stake in Spanish oil firm Repsol, worth about 2.2 billion euros, or $3 billion.
lead_paragraph: The sale ends a long relationship that had run into trouble over disagreements on policies ranging from top management to the handling of Repsol’s investments in Argentina.

headline.main: Pemex Sells $3 Billion Stake in Repsol, After Series of Clashes
headline.print_headline: Pemex Sells $3 Billion Stake in Repsol, After Series of Clashes
